'Okay, I'm good to go.'%K%P
I stood up and checked myself in the mirror\none more time.%K%P
Since asking Maika out the day before, I hadn't\nbeen able to keep still.%K%P
'No bedhead, right?'%K%P
The date we were going on today held the\nutmost importance for me.%K%P
There was no such thing as too prepared.%K%P
With that in mind, I checked my appearance\nanother three times until I was satisfied.%K%P
'I should probably get going.'%K%P
I took a look at my phone.\nIt was the perfect time to set out.%K%P
'Ah, Sho.'%K%P
'Hey, Sho.'%K%P
'Hi Inori, Akane.'%K%P
I ran into the two goddesses on the way to\nthe front door.%K%P
'Off on your date?'%K%P
'That's right.'%K%P
'Maika already left.'%K%P
'Huh? Really?'%K%P
I was planning to get to the park half an hour early.\nI didn't think she'd get there before me.%K%P
'Sorry guys, looks like I need to get going.'%K%P
'Of course. Good luck, Sho.'%K%P
'Don't you worry about us.\nStay out all night if you have to.'%K%P
'Why would they stay out all night?'%K%P
'Enough with the jokes, Akane.\nInori, please don't take her seriously.\nOkay, I'll see you later...'%K%P
'Bye!'%K%P
I stepped outside and headed in the direction\nof Kannagi Park.%K%P
'Better hurry. Shouldn't keep a lady waiting.'%K%P
'Ah! Sho...'%K%P
'Hey, sorry I'm late. Did I keep you waiting?'%K%P
Maika was already there by the time I arrived.%K%P
'No, I just got here myself.'%K%P
'B-Besides, it's not even close to when we said\nwe'd meet. Heh, this is like something from a\ncheesy romance manga.'%K%P
'So don't worry about the time, okay?'%K%P
'Sure, if you say so.'%K%P
Maika nodded and took a step closer to me.%K%P
I took a moment to really look at her.%K%P
I couldn't take my eyes away.%K%P
She was wearing a subtle amount of makeup and a few\naccessories to match her outfit. All these little\ntouches made her look even more stylish than usual.%K%P
'H-Hey...'%K%P
'Don't just stand there staring, say something.'%K%P
'Oh, sorry. You just look so beautiful,\nI couldn't help staring a little.'%K%P
'Huh?!'%K%P
Maika's cuteness level was through the roof.%K%P
I couldn't believe how lucky I was to be out on a\ndate with such a beautiful girl.%K%P
'Hey, don't say stuff like that!'%K%P
'You're not usually like this. Don't tease me!'%K%P
'I'm serious.'%K%P
'Sure, sure. So, where are going today?\nI'm assuming you have some kind of plan?'%K%P
'Of course.'%K%P
I did my best to stay cool as I watched Maika\nblush and try to avoid looking at me.%K%P
'You sound pretty confident. This better be good.'%K%P
'Oh it will be, trust me.'%K%P
'I guess we should-- Oh.'%K%P
'Hm? What's the-- Oh.'%K%P
We'd been so focused on each other we hadn't\nnoticed, but the park was a pretty popular date spot.%K%P
All around us were couples walking hand-in-hand.%K%P
'Sure are a lot of couples here today.'%K%P
'Yeah...'%K%P
'M-Maybe we should hold hands, too?\n...Just kiddi--'%K%P
'Oh, can we?'%K%P
'Huh? I-I only meant that as a jo--'%K%P
'I do want to hold your hand, though.'%K%P
'Uh... Okay, f-fine. If you really want to,\nI guess we can.'%K%P
'I really do. I really want to hold hands.'%K%P
'Well, that backfired on me...'%K%P
Surprised at my candor, Maika shifted her gaze,\nunsure of where to look.%K%P
'What's the matter? Are you hurt?'%K%P
'I-It's nothing! Come on.\nHere's my hand,\nhold it if you want to.'%K%P
'With pleasure.'%K%P
I gently enveloped Maika's hand in my own.%K%P
'Okay...'%K%P
Maika's hand was small, soft, warm.%K%P
I was aware of how different it was from the\nhand of a guy like me.%K%P
We walked together, hand-in-hand.%K%P
Just this simple act made me more nervous\nthan ever before.%K%P
'So, where are we going?'%K%P
'I thought we'd catch a movie.\nThere's that new theater that just opened up\nnear the shopping street.'%K%P
'Oh, right. I'm surprised you'd think of\nsomething like that.'%K%P
'Even I like a movie now and then.'%K%P
'Sure, but what kind of movie should we see?'%K%P
'We can decide when we get there.\nThat's part of the fun.'%K%P
I realized Maika and I were walking\na lot closer to each other.\nI guess we were starting to relax a little.%K%P
A gust of wind blew Maika's hair into my face,\nbringing with it a sweet smell.%K%P
'Something wrong, Sho?'%K%P
'Nah, it's just...you smell really nice.'%K%P
'Huh?!'%K%P
'What is that? It doesn't really smell like soap...'%K%P
'It's perfume.'%K%P
'Perfume, huh? I had no idea it could smell so good.'%K%P
'It can get overpowering if you put on too much,\neven for a natural floral scent like this.'%K%P
'Oh, cool. But you don't usually wear any, right?'%K%P
'Well, I don't get many chances to.'%K%P
'So you're wearing it for me?'%K%P
'I-I guess you can put it like that.\nThis is a date, after all.'%K%P
'I've got to get a little dressed up, even if it is\nonly you.'%K%P
Whoa. Let me just take that in.%K%P
Maika got dressed up just for me.%K%P
'What are you smirking at?'%K%P
'Nothing.'%K%P
'Urgh, whatever...'%K%P
'Oh, if it isn't Sho and Maika.'%K%P
'Hello, ma'am.'%K%P
'H-Hello...'%K%P
'How nice to see you... Oh?'%K%P
A woman we knew from the neighborhood called out to\nus as we entered the shopping street. When she got\ncloser, her eyes widened in surprise.%K%P
'Oh my, you're holding hands.\nI knew you two would\nget together sooner or later.'%K%P
'We're not really--'%K%P
'No need to hide it, dear! We should celebrate!'%K%P
'Well, we haven't exactly--'%K%P
'What's all this about?'%K%P
'Sho and Maika are finally together!'%K%P
'Oh! Nice going, you two.'%K%P
'They have? It's about time, if you ask me!'%K%P
'Congratulations, Maika.'%K%P
'P-Please, everyone...'%K%P
We were starting to draw a crowd now.%K%P
They all assumed we'd started going steady, and\nwere gathering around offering us kind words.%K%P
'Now this is a relief, I thought you two were never\ngoing to get serious.'%K%P
'The two of you have been friends since you were\nlittle, I always thought you'd make a good match.'%K%P
'Urrrgh...'%K%P
This could spell trouble.%K%P
Trying to find an opportunity to correct this\nmisunderstanding amid so many conversations\nwas pretty much impossible.%K%P
Maika was being approached on all sides, and\nwas starting to look dazed and confused.%K%P
'Uh, we need to get going...'%K%P
'Oh, of course! We didn't mean to\ninterrupt your date.'%K%P
'We're old enough to know better. C'mon, everyone,\nlet these two lovebirds through.'%K%P
One of the men clapped his hand and the crowd\nreluctantly parted for us.%K%P
'We'll ask ya all the juicy details later, Sho.\nYou treat Maika right, you hear?'%K%P
'Oof.'%K%P
He gave me a light slap on the back, then\nwandered back to his store.%K%P
'You okay, Sho?'%K%P
'Fine, totally fine.'%K%P
'They really didn't let up, huh?'%K%P
'I don't think they meant anything by it.'%K%P
'Yeah, but still... Thinking you and I were...\nA-Anyway, let's get going!'%K%P
Maika squeezed my hand a little harder,\ntrying to cover her embarrassment.%K%P
I walked along with her, still in awe of how cute\nshe was.%K%P
'Hey, Sho?'%K%P
'What's up?'%K%P
She finally calmed down after we got outside\nthe shopping street.%K%P
'Weren't you bothered that they thought we were\nboyfriend and girlfriend?'%K%P
'Hm? Why'd you think that?'%K%P
It wasn't like Maika to be so direct.%K%P
'It's just...you know. We're childhood friends.\nDoesn't the idea that people could get so confused--'%K%P
'It doesn't bother me.'%K%P
'It doesn't? Does that mean--'%K%P
'Here we are.'%K%P
'Oh, right.'%K%P
I wanted to give her a real answer, but that could\nwait just a little longer.%K%P
